718588f-a.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from White Street, showing an area
where second hand mechanical units are retailed.
November 2, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
718588f-a.folder: Centre Street & White Street, Manhattan, NY

718566f-a.text:
Centre Street, south from White Street to Foley Square, showing numerous city, state and federal structures. They are from left to right, the low New York State Pldm., the Federal Courts Bldg., the Municipal Bldg., the Tombs and the Criminal Couurts Bldg. The two last mentioned only appear partially and are opposite a cleared are on the east aide of Centre Street where their successors will rise. View No. 2 is from Franklin Street, one block to the South and shows mainly the Leonard Street side of the New York State Bldg.
June 10, 1938.
Vievs 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
718566f-a.folder: Centre Street & White Street, Manhattan, NY

718566f-b.text:
Centre Street, south from White Street to Foley Square, showing numerous city, state and federal structures. They are from left to right, the low New York State Pldm., the Federal Courts Bldg., the Municipal Bldg., the Tombs and the Criminal Couurts Bldg. The two last mentioned only appear partially and are opposite a cleared are on the east aide of Centre Street where their successors will rise. View No. 2 is from Franklin Street, one block to the South and shows mainly the Leonard Street side of the New York State Bldg.
June 10, 1938.
Vievs 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
718566f-b.folder: Centre Street & White Street, Manhattan, NY

724750f-b.text:
Wite Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Centre Street, showing prominently three 2 1/2 story buildings bearing No's. 118 to 122 inclusive. The photographer in No. 1 also shows a slight northward view on the east side of Centre Street. To the right is the north Westeriy corner of the new Criminal Courts site, same technically being the south east
corner of Centre and White Streets.
View No. 2 is northwestward from Franklin Street and shows in addition a corner of the old Criminal Courts Bldg. and a city
rented office structure.
June 12, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
724750f-b.folder: White Street & Centre Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

718589f-a.text:
133-139 Centre Street, at the N.W. corner of White Street, showing an interior of a 8-story structure renovated by the W.P.A.

August 12, 1936

W.P.A. Photo
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

(1)
118-122 white Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of
Centre Street.
June 22, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)  The same, as viewed from the clearance for the new Criminal Courts Building to be erected on the opposite side.
June 12, 1938.
P. L  . Sperr.

724754f-a.text:
White Street, south side, east from Centre to Baxter Streets, and showing under demolition buildings standing on what will be the northly side of the new Crimina Couurta Bldg. and prison site. These bear No's. 121 to 133 White Street; though the corner building also bore No's. 122-130 Centre Street. At the left are tenements on the east side of Bayard Street Ahich form a dead end for White
Street.
March 11, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
724754f-a.folder: White Street & Centre Street, Manhattan, NY
